captions.text: Why would one come to the impossible climb ?
Well it was a dream back to when I was a little girl
Yeah well that’s mainly a thing for insane people
manly dudes and tinkerers
because at the impossible climb... everything is possible
That’s the DIY and recycling temple
Here no need to take a 20 years loan to rise up
The regulation allows nearly everything
as long as you follow those basic rules:
the minimum wheelbase is 1.70m
This one is more than good since he’s 195cm
for fueling that’s regular gasoline but nitro is allowed too
wheel diameter: unrestricted
but there’s a limit you can't put a tractor wheel
where’s this limit written ? I don’t see any limit
I tell you I’ll put a tractor wheel
This means we can put whatever we want
But for the front tire it has to be an off-road tire
bolts: at will, fixed inside the tire
or scoops linked with stems, cables or chains
But it's dangerous those huge stems out of the tires ?!
Well the rider's seated on his bike so he’s not supposed
to put his bum on the wheels…
At risk to play the fakirs with hundreds of stems
stuck in the buttocks
just need to climb up there
The Bernex ski slope, in the Alps is a 188m tall wall
with a 89% inclination at its peak
Obviously it's not the “smouth as a baby’s bottom” kind
The soil is greasy, pebbles and stones widely spread
And to harden all this there’s even steps along the way
just to get it a little harder
And if you think it’s not enough there’s a corner up there
just before the final climb
So ? impossible or not ?
To get the answer you ought to try
riding style wise, we can find a bit of everything
Those making a lot of noise for nothing
The artists
The straight-forward guys
The pole planters
The left-wing voters
The captain abandoning the ship
The “without-hands” ones
The ones celebrating early although they lost
obviously they get angry
The backflips amateurs
Those taking off
Others like Laura Pascolini
prefer the climb down over the climb up
Nice for the boyfriend that lent his bike
Sometimes, love stories emerge from this slope
The show is not just here though
It is also in the paddock
with machines from another world
There’s literally everything
Over-boosted monocylinders
Tinkered twins
Howling four-cylinders
prototypes with two engines
Where can you buy this kind of bikes ?
Not in any dealer these are only prototypes
hand-made solely by passionate men
There’s even bikes with two-wheel drive
How does it work ?
Well rear wheel is one chain
And the other one there is for the hydraulic work
The front wheel works with hydraulic ?
Yes hydraulic with the engine and let’s go
To work with the front wheel
By the way, if you’re interested, this one’s on sale
You sell it because that’s crap ?!
No this no crap !
This isn't shit ?
No this it’s not shit !
But there’s problem for controlling
That's not really the pressure or ambiance from MotoGP
The impossible climb is more the realm of joyful tinkers
with a pinch of amateurism, a wrench in every hand
and dreams all over the mind
So the original engine is about 10-15cm larger
I cut out everything unnecessary
There’s still a clutch, cylinders and direct chain output
At the moment It’s 136hp but I’d like to gain more
There’s no fuel tank ?
I do, it’s just here look
How much do you have ? a glass ?
No no I have one liter
That’s one ecologic sport !
Yes you could say that
With one liter you run the whole season !
Let’s say I have the feeling this one
will consume more oil than gas at the moment
The goal is, of course, to get the highest possible
All the way up for the best of them
And better not release the bike
To spare the poor commissioners sure
but also to validate your own ascent
Hey ! hi !
Because that’s the front wheel axis that counts
measured by a geometer and his telemeter
But only after the bike is motionless
so be damned the one letting his machine drop down
For the others, those not going all the way up
nor all the way back down
that’s a windlass that brings the bike home
or whatever is left of it anyway
just to save time and the commissioners energy
As they not only grab the riders in free falls
or dodge the rolling bikes
but also rocks, roots and various objects
And then there’s the pros, the real ones
those aiming the top, guys with dahu blood in their veins
Here it’s not the height that is measured
but the time to get up there
And as in grand-prix, this is only a few millisecond fight
Perfect launch, maximum grip, full-throttle
physic riding, tight trajectories
and it takes off like a rocket
16.8s for the German André Oeschlin
winner of the Bernex Impossible Climb
with mean a rise at an average speed about 40km/h
respect !
So ? Not so impossible huh ?!

comments.text:
m'non faux, ils ont tout de même un cachet et un bon sens de l'article, de 
l'interview ce qui les met au dessus des "amateurs". ceci dit leurs vidéos 
ressemblent fort a celles des chaines que tu cites, c'est vrai. je suis 
lourd comme vous l'etes tous :) personne parlait de la vidéo presque quand 
j'ai posté, tout le monde criait:" ou est lolo ?" "trop nul y'a pas lolo" 
c'est super CHIANT. a un moment même LE lolo avait posté un commentaire 
pour essayer d'inverser la vapeur.

comments.author: Fabien D

comments.text:
Oui, sauf que sans lolo c'est pas mieux que les 4532558 autres chaines qui 
font elles aussi de superbes vidéos moto... comme MCN, SportRiderMagazine, 
Moto et Motards, MotoStationTV, MotoMag, etc. Donc, le coté "vous êtes 
lourds", s'toi qui est lourd. Parce que tu es lourd quand tu n'aimes pas la 
mayonnaise, t'es lourd quand tu trouves qu'il fait trop chaud, t'es lourd 
quand t'aimes pas le porno du samedi... parce que vu qu'on est lourd quand 
on exprime une opinion, c'est aussi valable pour toi!
